definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: The ultrasonic hardness tester is an versatile nondestructive tester.
sentences.chinese: 超声硬度计是一种普适的无损测试仪器。

sentences.english: An optimal control problem based on universal variable is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了普适变量下状态方程的最优控制问题。

sentences.english: So the results are very generally applicable.
sentences.chinese: 所以这些结果是普适的。

sentences.english: Instead, the “tribe” is valued far more than any universal ideology.
sentences.chinese: 相反，“部族”比其他任何普适观念都更有价值。

sentences.english: This quantity is called the universal gas constant.
sentences.chinese: 这个量叫做普适气体恒量。
宇宙普适常数并非“恒”量？

sentences.english: Entropy S is a state function, generally.
To be able to model the requirement of the pervasive usability, this paper inducts perceptual control model.
sentences.chinese: 为了能够建模普适可用性的需求，引入感知控制模型。

sentences.english: In chapter 13 we will look at a general technique for handling exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 十三章中我们会介绍普适的方法来处理例外。

sentences.english: But there can be no general rules, nor standard time-scale.
sentences.chinese: 但是不可能存在普适的规则，也不存在标准的时间表。

sentences.english: But in fact, there isn't a kind of universal-adapted explanation theory.
sentences.chinese: 事实上并不存在一种普适的解读理论。

sentences.english: Pervasive computing is a near synonym for ubicomp.
And we obtain the estimating formula of degree of causality for universal information source.
sentences.chinese: 对普适信源的因果度，也得出了估计公式。

sentences.english: Universal laws exist in our world.
sentences.chinese: 普适定律存在于我们这个世界。

sentences.english: Denmark, for example, is emerging as a leading center for pervasive computing.
sentences.chinese: 例如，丹麦正在发展成一个重要的普适计算中心。

definition: appropriate to any place and any time (idiom); universally applicable/a panacea
pinyin: fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3
fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3

definition: methodology/Discours de la méthode by René Descartes 笛卡兒|笛卡儿[Di2 ka3 er2], 1637
because of/on the basis of/in view of/on account of
in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
